intro: Andryala aestivalis, commonly known as the summer andryala, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Andryala aestivalis is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
